Package game.battle

Class Battle

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.battle.Battle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    K
    public class Battle
extends java.lang.Object
implements K
    This class represents a battle, where a player battles against an entity.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<Item> battleInventory
      Inventory of usable player items during battle.
      private Entity entity
      Represents the entity who fights with the player.
      private Player player
      Represents the player in a battle operated by the user.
      private java.util.Scanner scanner
      Stores a reference to a scanner which is used to record user input.
      private VisualEffectManager visualEffectManager
      Stores a visual effect manager which is used to clear the console.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Battle

        public Battle​(Player player,
              Entity entity,
              java.util.Scanner scanner,
              VisualEffectManager visualEffectManager)
        Parameters:
        player - Player in the battle.
        entity - Entity which fights the player.
        scanner - Scanner for taking user input.
        visualEffectManager - Used to clear the console.

    • Method Detail

      • doBattle

        public boolean doBattle()
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Core battle gameplay occurs inside this method.
        Returns:
        true if player wins, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If something goes wrong while the console is being cleared.

      • battlePlayerMenu

        private boolean battlePlayerMenu()
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        A battle menu for the player. Provides the user with different options, e.g. to use items against the enemy entity, attack the entity or to use consumables.
        Returns:
        true if the player chooses to exit the game. false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If something goes wrong while the console is being cleared.

      • doAttack

        private void doAttack​(Entity attacker,
                      Entity attacked)
        Performs an attack on the attacked entity with a random value derived from the attacker's max damage output. The attack can reduce the attacked entity's health with an attack by a value between zero up to the value of the attacker's max damage output.
        Parameters:
        attacker - Entity which performs the attack on the attacked entity.
        attacked - Entity attacked on by the attacker entity.

      • printAttackMessage

        private void printAttackMessage​(Entity attacker,
                                Entity attacked,
                                int inflictedDMG)
        Prints a message with information about the attacker and the attacked entities. Informs the user about how much damage was dealt by the attacker on the attacked and how much health the attacked has left in total after the attack was performed.
        Parameters:
        attacker - Entity which performed an attack.
        attacked - Entity which was attacked.
        inflictedDMG - Amount of damage inflicted on the attacked entity.

      • printWinsMessage

        private void printWinsMessage​(Entity winner,
                              Entity loser)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Prints a message with information about which entity won the battle.
        Parameters:
        winner - Entity which lost the battle.
        loser - Entity which won the battle.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If something goes wrong while clearing the console.

      • getBattleInventory

        private java.util.ArrayList<Item> getBattleInventory​(Player player)
        Used to recognize and thereafter store items usable during battle for the player.
        Parameters:
        player - The player in the battle.
        Returns:
        Battle items (with consumables included)

      • getBattleItemWithCommand

        private Item getBattleItemWithCommand​(char c)
        Returns an item usable during battle if the provided command coincides with the item's command property.
        Parameters:
        c - Character representing the use command of item.
        Returns:
        true if item with the provided use command exists in the battle inventory. false otherwise.

      • printBattleWeaponOptions

        private void printBattleWeaponOptions()
        Prints the weapons available for use by the player during battle.

      • printAttackOption

        private void printAttackOption()
        Prints the option for the player to attack with the valid attack-command.
